Dialogue.2: You, Samhi, and Rein spend the {time} preparing for the approaching Winter Festival by setting up decorations all across the Mermaid's Tale.
Dialogue.3: You take the pine branches and needles you gathered earlier and weave them into long strands of greenery, the rich smell of evergreen trees filling the inside of the building.
Dialogue.4: You hand a few to Samhi to take outside as you drape the remaining garlands over the bar and up and down the walls.
Dialogue.5: When you're finished, it almost looks like trees are growing through the walls and erupting into the common room.
Dialogue.6: You walk out and somehow Samhi has found himself on the roof
Dialogue.7: Rein is painting a big moon over the ocean on the front of the door, and caps off her imagery with a circular wreath to frame it
Dialogue.8: Some chatter among the group, people generally in good spirits
Dialogue.9: A townsfolk walks by and says how delightful it all looks
Dialogue.11: Watching it all come together makes you feel inspired; maybe you do have an artistic streak in you!
